intro: Verbascum artvinense, commonly known as the Artvin mullein, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stem covered in soft, velvety hairs. The plant produces large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing in open, sunny areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
